circumstances: Derek Thomas, an 18-year-old social researcher, was reported missing after he left home during an argument with his sister. This occurred following his withdrawal from university, which had been a source of tension at home. Derek's disappearance was initially concerning due to the suddenness of his actions and his lack of contact with family. Last spotted by his uncle at a shopping mall on Millburn Road, Inverness, Derek seemed anxious and withdrawn. Despite refusing help at the time, he was later traced by police to an address on Culduthel Avenue, Inverness. Derek was found safe and confirmed his need for some space to rethink his future plans.
entities_pattern_types: withdrawn from university,left home during argument
q_10_explanation: Recent family conflict due to argument with sister.
q_14_explanation: Withdrawal from university created tension at home.
q_17_explanation: Going missing was unusual for him, linked to family argument.
q_18_explanation: He indicated needing space to rethink his future.
q_20_explanation: Last seen at a mall, appeared anxious and seemed to need space.

circumstances: Derek Thomas, a 19-year-old male from Ely, went missing after an intense argument at his home on Station Road, Achnasheen. Troubled by an ongoing identity crisis, Derek left abruptly, creating concerns among his family, including his sister and grandmother. His abrupt departure led him to wander aimlessly, eventually bringing him to a shopping mall, where he was seen by a friend who later reported his disoriented state. The friend described Derek's behavior as erratic and suggested he seemed to be searching for something or someone. Later, Derek visited a cemetery, where he spent several hours, perhaps in contemplation. A few days later, he was found by family in the basement of an abandoned building on Harbour Road, Inverness. Thankfully, he was unharmed, though visibly shaken, and returned home safely after receiving support.
q_5_explanation: Derek is experiencing an ongoing identity crisis affecting his mental health.

q_18_explanation: The argument and identity crisis likely drove Derek to leave unexpectedly.

circumstances: Derek Thomas, a social researcher, was reported missing after a heated argument at his home on Station Road, Achnasheen. Leaving the house abruptly, he mentioned visiting his uncle but never arrived. Later, Derek was reportedly seen near 48 Orchard Park, Beauly, as well as at a local synagogue where someone matching his description was noted to have engaged in deep conversation with attendees before disappearing again. circumstances: Derek Thomas was last seen at a shopping mall located on Sir Walter Scott Drive, Inverness, IV2 6BZ, where witnesses reported seeing him talking with a friend, Ryan Harrison. Ryan mentioned that Derek was planning a visit to the family farm later, as he often helped out there on weekends. After leaving the mall, it was unclear which direction Derek headed, but his grandmother noted that he failed to arrive at daycare pickup on time for a routine volunteer activity. Searches by family members at a nearby cemetery known for being a quiet retreat for Derek yielded no clues. Concerns escalated, and the police were informed. Derek was eventually located in good health at an acquaintance's residence on Culduthel Avenue, bringing relief to his sister and whole family.

circumstances: Derek Thomas was last seen leaving his home on Station Road, Achnasheen, following an argument with his brother. Prior to his departure, Derek had been active on social media, posting about frustrations regarding recent conflicts. Witnesses reported that he headed towards Great North Road, Muir of Ord, IV6 7XR, where he was expected to meet his uncle, Donald Taylor, at a local grocery store. He never made it to the meeting, raising concerns among his family members. Search efforts focused on familiar locations, including the synagogue where he occasionally attended professional networking events. Derek was eventually traced to Hamilton Crescent, located in IV30 4NW, by the police, safe and unharmed.
